elements.title: Vasoorimala (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the goddess Vasoorimala (devotee pictured) is a deity associated with communicable diseases like smallpox, chickenpox, and measles?

elements.title: Space 220 Restaurant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, for the Space 220 Restaurant, Disney reached out to NASA engineers to understand what a space elevator might look like?

elements.title: Stsiapan Putsila (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stsiapan Putsila faces criminal charges in Belarus—as does the Polish judge who refused to extradite him?

elements.title: WNAO-TV (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that North Carolina television station WNAO-TV operated from a converted supper club?

elements.title: Alois Wyrsch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alois Wyrsch, the first member of colour of the Swiss parliament, was born to a mercenary in the Dutch Indies in 1825?

elements.title: Dalton Mills (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that copper thieves started a fire at Dalton Mills in 2011 while trying to burn off the insulation?

elements.title: Carrie Campbell Severino (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that legal activist Carrie Campbell Severino, who co-authored a book about Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination, was once a law clerk for Justice Clarence Thomas?

elements.title: Woody Allen's glasses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Spanish city of Oviedo only repairs Woody Allen's glasses once a year?
